summary: Mount Whitney is the tallest mountain in the United States (not including Alaska). It stands at 14,505 feet high in the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. The mountain is special because it's not far from the lowest point in North America, Badwater Basin. Its western side is in Sequoia National Park, and the top is the end of the John Muir Trail. The eastern side is in Inyo National Forest.
title: Mount Whitney
